text: The Lincoln Boulevard Transit Line is a proposed 10 mile bus rapid transit or light rail transit line in the Metro network in Los Angeles, California. It is planned to operate on a north to south route on Lincoln Boulevard between the Green Line and Crenshaw/LAX Line's Aviation/96th Street station with the E Line's Downtown Santa Monica station on the Metro Rail system. A proposed completion date of 2047 for BRT and unknown for rail. It is funded by Measure M & R. The route will have signal priority at traffic lights and will have a dedicated right of way. ==History== One seat ride from Airport Metro Connector to the E Line via a bus rapid transit corridor along Lincoln Bl. The BRT will be converted to a rail service in the future if ridership outgrows the bus rapid service capacity. The corridor will service LAX, Playa Del Rey, Westchester, Venice and Santa Monica. All beach communities along Santa Monica bay. ==References== ==External links== * https://www.metro.net/projects/ Category:Los Angeles Metro Busway projects Metro Rapid Metro Rapid Category:Bus rapid transit in California Category:Proposed railway lines in California Category:Transportation in Los Angeles Category:Public transportation in Los Angeles County, California
title: Lincoln Boulevard Transit Corridor
